noun.description: Rhetoric. The rhetorical device by which a speaker proceeds to comment on a passage which he or she has just quoted.
Medicine. A critical review, summary, or discussion of a case, condition, or body of research.

origin: Late 16th century. From Hellenistic Greek ἐπίικρισις determination, judgement from ancient Greek ἐπικρίνειν to decide, determine + -σις.
